Package com.xd.cps2002

Class MainGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xd.cps2002.game.MainGame
  • public class MainGame
extends java.lang.Object
    The MainGame class is responsible for coordinating the main logic of the game, and the primary interface for user input and provision of output to the user. It implements a Singleton design pattern, and is designed to be the primary interface to the game API, providing descriptive and detailed errors. Moreover, it handles the majority of setup and is designed to prevent the execution of setup steps in an invalid procedural order, if done so through this class. Otherwise access to the sub-systems is left unhindered by this class. The setup sequence via this class is intended to be executed in the following manner, with a number of checks to ensure so: [label:start setupPlayers(int n_players) -> setupMap(int map_size) -> setPlayerPositions()] |-> reset() goto:start
    Author:
    Xandru Mifsud

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainGame

        private MainGame()
        Private constructor to initialize an MainGame instance (if one does not already exist).

    • Method Detail

      • getMainGame

        public static MainGame getMainGame()
        Returns an MainGame instance; in the case that an instance already exists, it returns the exisiting one. Else it creates a new instance and returns it.
        Returns:
        MainGame instance is the singleton to be returned.

      • dereferenceMainGame

        public static void dereferenceMainGame()
        Dereferences the MainGame instance to null.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Sets the MainGame.players and MainGame.map to null, allowing for the setup functions to be called again sequentially.

      • setupPlayers

        public void setupPlayers​(int n_players)
                  throws InvalidNumberOfPlayersException
        Initializes n_players Player instances, if n_players is not less than 2 or greater then 8.
        Parameters:
        n_players - is the number of players to be initialized.
        Throws:
        SetupOperationPrecedenceException - is thrown if a Map instances has already been created.
        InvalidNumberOfPlayersException - is thrown if the number of players is < 2 or > 8.

      • setupMap

        public void setupMap​(int map_size)
              throws InvalidMapSizeException
        Initializes a Map of type map_type and size map_size, provided that: i. Any players in the game have been initialized (i.e. MainGame.players is not null) ii. The map_size is not less than 5 and not greater than 50. iii. If the number of players is at least 5, than the minimum map_size is at least 8.
        Parameters:
        map_size - is the size of the map.
        Throws:
        SetupOperationPrecedenceException - is thrown if MainGame.players is null. [Criteria i. above]
        InvalidMapSizeException - is thrown if the map_size is invalid. [Criteria ii. & iii. above]

      • setPlayerPositions

        public void setPlayerPositions()
        Initializes the starting position for all the Player instance in MainGame.players.
        Throws:
        SetupOperationPrecedenceException - is thrown if a Map instance has not already been created, or if MainGame.players is null.

      • setHTMLDirectory

        public void setHTMLDirectory​(java.lang.String dir)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Simple function to set the directory path at which to write the generated HTML maps.
        Parameters:
        dir - is the directory path specified by the user, in which to write the HTML files.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown whenever the path specified is not a directory.

      • writeHTMLFiles

        public void writeHTMLFiles()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Convenience function for generating and persisting to disk the HTML map file for each player instance in players.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown when there is a failure in persisting to disk [generally fatal].
